challenge.title: Step 22
challenge.description: In the same way, modify the remaining two lists considering that the C-D distance is 7.

tests.text: my_graph['C'] should be a list containing the tuples ('B', 4) and ('D', 7).
tests.testString:
({ test: () => assert(runPython(`
    tuples = [("B", 4), ("D", 7)]
    len(my_graph["C"]) == 2 and all(t in my_graph["C"] for t in tuples) 
  `))
})

tests.text: my_graph['D'] should be a list containing the tuples ('A', 1) and ('C', 7).
tests.testString:
({ test: () => assert(runPython(`
    tuples = [("A", 1), ("C", 7)]
    len(my_graph["D"]) == 2 and all(t in my_graph["D"] for t in tuples)
  `))
})

({ test: () => assert(runPython(`
    key_list = ["A", "B", "C", "D"]
    len(my_graph) == 4 and all(key in my_graph for key in key_list)
  `))
})

tests.text: my_graph['A'] should be a list containing the tuples ('B', 3) and ('D', 1).
tests.testString:
({ test: () => assert(runPython(`
    tuples = [("B", 3), ("D", 1)]
    len(my_graph["A"]) == 2 and all(t in my_graph["A"] for t in tuples)
  `))
})

tests.text: my_graph['B'] should be a list containing the tuples ('A', 3) and ('C', 4).
tests.testString:
({ test: () => assert(runPython(`
    tuples = [("A", 3), ("C", 4)]
    len(my_graph["B"]) == 2 and all(t in my_graph["B"] for t in tuples)
  `))
})

challengeFiles.name: main
